intro: Astragalus eskishehiricus, commonly known as the Eskisehir milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are compound, with small leaflets that help reduce water loss, and it produces pods that contain edible seeds. Astragalus eskishehiricus is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
